_consent:
▶ Double click to read the declaration of consent   

 


 I have been informed that my participation is completely voluntary.
 I understand that I may withdraw my consent to participate in this study at any time without giving any reason and without personal disadvantage.
 Upon revocation of my consent to participate in the study, I have the right to have all of my personal data stored as part of this study deleted. If the data have already been anonymized, this is equivalent to deletion of the data. I hereby consent to the processing of my personal data for the research purposes described above in the manner described above.




What happens to my data? 

It goes without saying that all staff and researchers involved in the project work in accordance with the provisions of the General Data Protection Regulation, the Federal Data Protection Act, and the relevant state data protection laws. For the project, we work together with research facilities, universities, institutes, or laboratories in the EU. These are also obliged to comply with data protection. Your data will be stored anonymously immediately after collection and then statistically analyzed. No conclusions can subsequently be drawn about you from the results. The data is stored on a server within the EU, which is not operated by IDOS.
locationFilter:
As this survey is aiming to collected responses across all age groups and regions across India...

 

Please provide us with information of which region you are from:
ageFilter: Please provide us with your age:
genderFilter: Please provide us with your gender:
q_main_energy_ov:
It is very helpful for us to understand how much people know about their country's electricity and energy consumption and production. In this part we therefore ask you to take your best guess!



Do not worry, your answer will not follow any consequences in the rest of the survey!



In your best guess, which is the main fuel for electricity production in India?
q_climate_policy_ov_1:
We would like to know a couple of things about your relationship with energy and climate policies. 



How familiar are you with your governments efforts to address  environmental issues and reduce greenhouse gas emissions? - 7
q_energy_policy_ov_1: How familiar are you with your governments efforts to address energy issues and secure energy access to the population? - 7
q_coal_sub_ov:
Do you think that your government provides financial support to the production of coal in your country?

If you do not know, even your guess gives us valuable insight!
q_elec_sub_ov:
Do you think that your government provides financial support to the pricing of electricity in your country?

If you do not know, even your guess gives us valuable insight!
will_to_bear_cost: Are you generally willing to bear higher costs or to change your behavior and lifestyle in order to protect the climate?
climate_policy_sup_1: To what extent do you support policies to protect the climate and reduce emissions? - 8

justice_1:
We will now wrap up the survey, by asking some last questions. 






How important are the following in the context of an energy transition? 

Please indicate how important you think the different context are on a scale from not at all important to extremely important. You will be shown one context at a time. - Procedural justice: 
Access to decision-making processes that govern the energy transition should be equitable and the procedure should engage all stakeholders in a non-discriminatory way.
justice_2:
We will now wrap up the survey, by asking some last questions. 






How important are the following in the context of an energy transition? 

Please indicate how important you think the different context are on a scale from not at all important to extremely important. You will be shown one context at a time. - Distributive justice: 
The distribution of costs and benefits from the energy transition should be just and fair.
justice_3:
We will now wrap up the survey, by asking some last questions. 






How important are the following in the context of an energy transition? 

Please indicate how important you think the different context are on a scale from not at all important to extremely important. You will be shown one context at a time. - Recognitional justice: 

Individuals must be fairly represented in the energy transition process, free from physical threats and granted complete and equal political rights. A lack of recognition can manifest as various forms of cultural and political domination, insults, degradation and devaluation
justice_4:
We will now wrap up the survey, by asking some last questions. 






How important are the following in the context of an energy transition? 

Please indicate how important you think the different context are on a scale from not at all important to extremely important. You will be shown one context at a time. - Restorative justice:

In the energy transition focus should be on the needs of the victims, such as nations, citizens and nature. It restores them to their original position prior to a damaging activity.
trust_in_government_1: Below you will find 3 statements. Please indicate how much you agree with the statements on a scale from Strongly Disagree to Strongly Agree. - The government will take many perspectives into account when making a decision about policies to decrease the consumption of coal.
trust_in_government_2: Below you will find 3 statements. Please indicate how much you agree with the statements on a scale from Strongly Disagree to Strongly Agree. - The government provides all of the available information to the public when making a decision about policies to decrease the consumption of coal.
trust_in_government_3: Below you will find 3 statements. Please indicate how much you agree with the statements on a scale from Strongly Disagree to Strongly Agree. - In general, I trust the government.
household_members_12:
In order to understand respondents answers, it helps to know a bit more about their life situation.



First, please indicate the total amount of adults with household income in the box below. With adult we mean any person in the household, contributing with income. - Number of adults in household:
household_income:
Monthly household income means the total amount of income in the household you live within, over one month. You provided that you were [Field-household_members] adults in your household. 



Please find the corresponding interval:
opinion_coal_ind:
In our two last question, we are interested in what you think! 



To answer is completely voluntarily. However, anything you write is valuable for us!



Do you have any thoughts about the role of the coal industry in [QID96-ChoiceGroup-SelectedChoices] after doing this survey?
feedback: Finally, we would really appreciate hearing what you think about the survey and your experience. Please write a short sentence (or more if you like) about how you found this survey.
